page.title: 10Farming at Charborough
page.content: There are twelve farms belonging to Charborough Estate, which is owned by the{Erle-Drax}family. These farms are tenanted. There are 70 men employed on the Estate itself, in farming and forestry. There is a large{deerpark}where fallow, roe, red and sika deer roam, they are culled for a venison crop. The other animals are sheep, mainly grey-faced mules, and a large herd of Friesian dairy cows. Arable crops are also grown. The farming policy is{pro-European and it is considered most profitable for such a big farming enterprise to stick to it's present pattern of farming and utilisation of land.
